channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Savernake Bridge, 6th November
item.description:
Lights on the bridge aren’t turning on early enough. Only on at 17:20 but sunset almost an hour ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Constantine Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Concrete slab in road, 6th November
item.description:
This outside no 31 and 33 a concrete slab has fallen from one of the grass beds into the road due to a car hitting it. We’ve attempted to move it and cannot. Several people have hit their cars on it. In general these beds are very high and 2x people hit their cars on the other side yesterday as well causing damage to their cars. Please could this be removed from the road and these kerbs reviwed for safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Johns Road, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Asphalt used to replace paving, 6th November
item.description:
A work gang came to the Avenue yesterday and took up 2 or 3 metres of pavement slabs outside of number 36. These were replaced by an ugly strip of black asphalt. I am hoping that this is only a temporary situation because not only does it look ugly , it will undoubtedly sink over winter. Today a grab lorry came and took away the old slabs. Can you please advise why this has been done and when the pavement will be properly replaced with slabs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, The Avenue, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Road, Penge, London

item.title: Abandoned bike - stripped and rusty, 6th November
item.description:
Frequent previous reports lead to no reaction. First reported during the pandemic Missing parts and rusty chain and flat tires

item.title: Four months car and trailer abandoned, 6th November
item.description:
One photo from 9 July 2025 One photo from 3 November 2025 car and trailer gathering significant build up of leaves and debris (cardboard) and attracting flytipping. Have not moved for four months minimum No MOT therefore should not be on public highway. Still taxed but not looking "loved and cherished" Government guidance for councils to comply with their duty to remove abandoned vehicles states that an abandoned vehicle is likely to meet one of several criteria, one of which is "IT'S STATIONARY FOR A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF TIME". Four months is surely a significant amount of time?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three piece leather suite dumpted against thexwall, 6th November
item.description:
Three piece suite dumpted outside number 26 kempt street against the side wall been therec 2 weeks now in the footpath again where there are people in wheelchairs a hazzard when is the cuncil going to put cct cameras up was told three years, ago this would happen nothing come on royal borough of greenwich get this sorted please im sick of beingvthe only one reporting things its unacceptable especially when we all oay rent and council tax that goes up every year where does,all the money go i ask
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kempt Street, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsecure tree, 6th November
item.description:
On the 03/10/25 the large oak tree outside of 109 Plaistow lane, had fallen but not completely down, this tree has 9 large limbs that are rotten and insecure. The team assessed on 07/10/25 but could not climb due to the rotten dead tree (contractors Chris wood and atoms) since this time the tree has become a lot more unstable, with large limbs falling and potential accident could happen, the tree has been deemed unsafe and is in need of urgent attention to be cut down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Silver Van. Untaxed. Expired MOT. Dumped, 6th November

item.title: Tarmac, 6th November
item.description:
I reported this uneven surface 2 times in 3 years but nothing ever done, One of bexley bin men nearly twisted his ankle today as tarmac surface is very uneven and cracked outside 89 Newbery Rd, whole pavement and kerb stones need re doing cause of if many vans/lorries mounting pavement causing kerb stones to crack and sink.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newbery Road, North End, London
